intro: Restio pilisepalus, commonly known as the coastal restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in coastal and mountainous regions. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale blue flowers. It is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dunes and fynbos vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is an important component of the local flora.
